arma

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Mat

  • public class Mat
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a real-valued dense matrix with double precision and member functions as well as attributes similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library (Armadillo) by Conrad Sanderson et al., based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles' Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) Version 0.23 from 21.06.2013.

    If not stated otherwise (marked as non-canonical in case), the provided interfaces is identical to Armadillo (e.g. same ordering of arguments, accepted values, ...). However, this project is based on EJML to provide a pure Java solution, which is why numeric results may slightly differ from the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library.

    Note: Armadillo stores values by column-major-ordering, while EJML stores them by row-major ordering. In order to be similar to Armadillo, all interfaces work as if column-major-ordering is used while converting to row-major ordering internally.

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

      • Mat

        public Mat(int numberOfElements,
   Fill fillType)
        Creates a column vector with numberOfElements elements that is filled according to fillType.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if fillType is one of RANDU or RANDN. Use Mat(int, int, Fill, Random) instead.

        Parameters:
        numberOfElements - The number of elements.
        fillType - The fill type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if fillType is one of RANDU or RANDN. Use Mat(int, int, Fill, Random) instead.

        Non-canonical: An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if fillType is one of Fill.RANDU or Fill.RANDN. Use Mat(int, int, Fill, Random) instead.

        fillType - The fill type.

    • Method Detail

      • at

        public double at(int i,
        int j)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value of the element at the ith row and jth column.

        Non-canonical:

        • Performs boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the requested position is out of bound.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the element.
        j - The column of the element.
        Returns:
        The value of the element at the nth row and jth column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested position is out of bound.
        See Also:
        at(int)

      • at

        public void at(int i,
      int j,
      Op operation)
        Performs a unary right-hand side operation on the value of the element at the nth row and jth column and overwrites it with the result.

        Non-canonical:

        • Performs boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the requested position is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the left-hand side operand.
        j - The column of the left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested position is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        See Also:
        at(int, Op, double)

      • at

        public void at(int i,
      int j,
      Op operation,
      double operand)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
               java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the element at the nth row and jth column. The value of the requested element will be overwritten by the result of the operation.

        Non-canonical:

        • Performs a boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the requested position is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the left-hand side operand.
        j - The column of the left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested position is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        See Also:
        at(int, Op, double)

      • at

        public double at(int n)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix.

        Note: at(i, j)= at(i + j * n_rows).

        Non-canonical:

        • Performs a boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the requested position is out of bound.
        Parameters:
        n - The position of the element.
        Returns:
        The value of the nth element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested position is out of bound.
        See Also:
        at(int, int)

      • at

        public void at(int n,
      Op operation,
      double operand)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
               java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix. The value of the requested element will be overwritten by the result of the operation.

        Note: at(i, j) = at(i + j * n_rows).

        Non-canonical:

        • Performs a boundary checks. Note: There is no element access provided without boundary checks.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the requested position is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        n - The position of the left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested position is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        See Also:
        at(int, int, Op, double)

      • col

        public Mat col(int j)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return a copy of the jth column as a (n_rows, 1) matrix.

        Non-canonical: >A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the requested column is out of bound.

        Parameters:
        j - The column to be copied.
        Returns:
        The copied column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested column is out of bound.

      • col

        public void col(int j,
       Op operation,
       Mat operand)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on all elements of the jth column.

        Non-canonical:

        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the provided right-hand side operand is not a column-vector. Use cols(int, int, Op, Mat) instead.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the number of rows of the left-hand side does not match with the provided right-hand side operand.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the requested column is out of bound. position is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        j - The column of the left-hand side operands.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the provided right-hand side operand is not a column-vector or if the number of rows of the left-hand side does not match with the provided right-hand side operand or if the requested column is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.

      • col

        public void col(int j,
       Op operation,
       double operand)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on all elements of the jth column. The single provided right-hand side operand is used for all operations.

        Non-canonical:

        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the requested column is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        j - The column of the left-hand side operands.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested column is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.

      • row

        public void row(int i,
       Op operation,
       Mat operand)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on all elements of the ith row.

        Non-canonical:

        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the provided right-hand side operand is not a row-vector. Use rows(int, int, Op, Mat) instead.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the number of columns of the left-hand side does not match with the provided right-hand side operand.
        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the requested row is out of bound. position is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the left-hand side operands.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the provided right-hand side operand is not a row-vector or if the number of columns of the left-hand side does not match with the provided right-hand side operand or if the requested row is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.

      • row

        public void row(int i,
       Op operation,
       double operand)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on all elements of the ith row. The single provided right-hand side operand is used for all operations.

        Non-canonical:

        • A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the requested row is out of bound.
        • A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the left-hand side operands.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the requested row is out of bound.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Non-canonical: Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.

      • elem

        public Mat elem(Mat selection)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a column vector containing all elements for which selection.at(n) > 0 holds.
        Parameters:
        selection - The selection to be used.
        Returns:
        The copy of the selected elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the number of elements of the matrix does not match with the provided selection.

      • set_size

        public void set_size(int numberOfElements)
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements -

      • set_size

        public void set_size(int numberOfRows,
            int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and neither guarantees to reuse the values of the elements, nor their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        reshape(int, int, boolean), resize(int)

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns)
        Equivalent to reshape(numberOfRows, numberOfColumns, true)
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns,
           boolean rowWise)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements, but not their positions. The elements of the current matrix are either accessed row-wise (rowWise = true) or column-wise ( rowWise = false), while the new matrix is always filled column-wise.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        rowWise - The access of the elements of the current matrix .
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), resize(int, int)

      • resize

        public void resize(int numberOfElements)
        Parameters:
        numberOfElements -

      • resize

        public void resize(int numberOfRows,
          int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements and their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), reshape(int, int, boolean)

      • updateAttributes

        private void updateAttributes()
        Updates the attributes n_rows, n_cols and n_elem of the matrix. Should be called right after the shape of the matrix is changed.

      • convertMajorOrdering

        int convertMajorOrdering(int n)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the position of an element based on a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix into a row-major-ordered based one, in order to provide interfaces similar to Armadillo's Mat while using EJML's DenseMatrix64F.
        Parameters:
        n - The position based on column-major-ordering.
        Returns:
        The position based on row-major-ordering.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if a negative value is provided for the position.
